name: malignant pleural solitary fibrous tumor
definition: A pleural cancer that is located_in mesenchymal cells in the areolar tissue subjacent to the mesothelial-lined pleura. [url:https\://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17075563]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, patients with solitary fibrous tumors demonstrated a median progression free survival of 2 months and five patients demonstrated an objective tumor response when treated with Sprycel (dasatinib) (PMID: 27696380).

references.title: Phase 2 study of dasatinib in patients with alveolar soft part sarcoma, chondrosarcoma, chordoma, epithelioid sarcoma, or solitary fibrous tumor.

clinicalTrials.title: Doxorubicin Plus Dual Checkpoint Blockade for Soft Tissue Sarcomas
